title: Zz Rot Portal
body:
does anyone else think this is an OP item

Zz'Rot Portal

You can now build Portals which spawn little Voidspawns who explode on enemy structures.

“Think of this new item as a follow-up to our original preseason promise of adding more strategic diversity to League of Legends. Specifically, the Zz'Rot Portal is designed to provide tanky dudes with a new way to opt into pushing strategies while also having enough utility to be used in other creative ways.”

RECIPE :  Raptor Cloak + Negatron Cloak + 950 gold 

TOTAL COST :  2800 gold 

ARMOR :  +50 

MAGIC RESISTANCE :  +50 

BASE HEALTH REGENERATION :  +100% 

UNIQUE PASSIVE :  Point Runner: Builds up to 30% Movement Speed over 2 seconds while near turrets or Void Gates. 

COOLDOWN :  150 seconds 

UNIQUE ACTIVE :  Spawns a Void Gate at target location for 150 seconds. Every 4 seconds the gate makes a Voidspawn that travels down the nearest lane. Voidspawn explode when attacking structures. Voidspawn ignore champions and void targets (150 second cooldown.) After the third Voidspawn made by Void Gate, additional Voidspawn gain 50% of your Armor and Magic Resistance as damage

This is a new item riot introduced in patch 5.1.
and frankly I don't like what it adds to the game.
minions constantly barraging your towers for 150 seconds.
im not sure correct me if im wrong but I think it creates a wall that you and your teammates can pass through but the enemy cant!?!
come on rito doesn't that seam a little OP?

replies.body:
It does **not** create a team exclusive pathing wall. I believe you mixed that up with a different thing that released with 5.1.

The void gate can be destroyed. Voidspawn will only barrage your turrets for 150 seconds if you can't kill that.
The voidspawn also lose health over time. If they manage to take a tower, usually they won't be able to take another tower. Very risky positioning of the void gate does allow it to take multiple towers but it's very easy for the enemy to access in those cases (like placing it between two enemy towers).

What if they, say in a game I recently had, have four people using them, they would plant it, wave clear, and keep us away from the voidlings and portal while the portals decimated our towers and inhibs

They invested a lot of gold into non-offensive stats for that.
The voidspawn ignore champions. The gates themselves provide no direct combat value.

You have two major strategic options to dealing with them:
1. The direct approach
Commit your AP Carry to clearing the voidspawn; they are weak to magic damage.
They sacrificed gold potential into tower pressure potential. Initiate once you setup a clear route. Try to flank if you can.
If you have problems initiating, Righteous Glory was made for that reason.
2. The indirect approach
They spent into turret pressure and NOT epic monster pressure. Epic monsters ignore voidspawn (except for incidental "it just happened to be there" damage)
Pressure Dragon and Baron more. Especially Dragon.

So, am I correct in assuming that this is an alternate playstyle that you don't plan on nerfing or removing because it's different? This reminds me very strongly of when teams would stack Promote or Fortify, which you guys removed. I love when there are nonstandard things a team can do to win, but I've kind of just come to assume that whenever anything other than "win teamfight then push" or "sneak baron then push" becomes viable, then it'll get patched out soon.

Well, I don't **plan** on nerfing it.

The balance of Zz'Rot Portal and the *perception* of the balance of Zz'Rot Portal is tricky. I actually think the item could use some buffs (in the realms of AI fixes).

Zz'Rot Portal is an item of constrained opportunity (which I believe is a good thing, or at least worth the risk of it). The strategies it opens are very different and the opportunity for those strategies is very limited. (1)
There's a strong risk of "What do I do now?" when playing against it because of that difference. (2)

Zz'Rot also **represents** very clearly the idea of "Win More". I don't think it's actually any better at this than another heavy item investment, you're getting substantial power over your opponent either way, just that Zz'Rot is very very visible (it creates a structure that you can see) and thus it's easy to blame.
The other aspect of this is that the opportunities that normally constrain Zz'Rot are, of course, increased for a winning team.


First, I don't think "Win More" is that big of a deal (in this case) and the perception may go away (or I may learn different and it might be a problem. Too early to tell).
Beyond that though, I would like to speak on the points I numbered for as far as balancing the item goes.

1: This is where I think a few polishing AI fixes could go a long way (as a buff!). Things such as "Rescan for a new direction to spawn after a turret goes down" or "When I place near top lane inhibitor, I expect it to go towards top lane inhibitor" (it's lane detection is a little wonky) will make opportunities for it more clear.

2: This is where most of the nerfs (overall probably) came from last patch. There was a sentiment of not being able to address it for certain team comps. This type of sentiment actually squashes out fringe compositions, since there is a feeling of "We can't run this comp because of this item restriction". Sometimes this is good (Ignite's existence provides a base line to pushing out sustain stacking comps) and sometimes this is bad.

After 5.2 though, I actually think Zz'Rot has a pretty healthy amount of 2 while needing more of 1. Basically, personally, I believe it might need a slight fix up buff.

With the ZZ Rot portal having a name close to mine I've had people ask if it was named after me I always say yes because why not

It's exactly like GA, except it has Point Runner and HP regen (woohoo) and spawns a portal instead of reviving you.  It might be OP on Heimer (drop portal, surround with turrets, massive pressure), but it seems alright generally.

I coin that Heimer build the "Hatchery Heimerdinger", after the Zerg of Starcraft fame. You can actually find a topic I made about it in the Tips & Tricks board.

It's surprisingly good on him, especially since he gets 41 base health regen at level 18.

Heres why ZZrot isnt OP
-costs a ton of gold for non offensive stats
-the vodilings focus minions (not just turrets)
-the portal can be destroyed
-The voidlings start to die after a short time meaning you cant just place it in your base and your set to go
-it scales off your mr/armor meaning its useless if you arent a tank
-it actually really gives tankier supports a good item to help push with their team
-its not OP if anything it might need a small buff 
-the buff should be the the voidlings cant be targeted by enemy champions if they voidlings wont target enemy champions

I actually think that the smaller minions need to be a bit stronger, the smaller minions don't really do much in the way of wave clear, or tower pushing... 
On that note, if the smaller ones were brought up in power, the larger ones could have a decrease in power to compensate... 

I really enjoyed using the original zz'rot portal. I don't ever really purchase the new zz'rot portal...

After a lot of Leona games where I've gotten this game, I can list a few things about it from practice:

- Zz'Rot Portal can be very difficult to deal with if your team is ahead, but cannot be used effectively if you are behind.
- Zz'Rot Portal takes a long time to get to, as rushing it as a first item tends to be suicide in any build. It's almost always a 3rd or further major item.
- Zz'Rot Portal relies on your team protecting it, otherwise it won't accomplish much.
- Zz'Rot Portal Voidspawns are no match for Super Minions.

In essence, the item only works when your team is ahead, not when behind.

I think that it could use a small anti-minion buff, actually. Maybe when they are killed, they explode and deal damage to nearby enemy minions (does not damage Champions).
It's like a slightly stronger minion wave, but only to a very limited extent.
